text: The voiced bilabial plosive or stop is a type of consonantal sound used in many spoken languages. The symbol in the International Phonetic Alphabet that represents this sound is , and the equivalent X-SAMPA symbol is `b`. The voiced bilabial stop occurs in English, and it is the sound denoted by the letter in obey (`obeI`). ==Features== Features of the voiced bilabial stop: ==Varieties== {| class="wikitable" ! IPA !!
